Description: Canonical registry defining template roles used by the LOGOS externalization system. This registry is authoritative for tooling, runtime compilation, and external collaborators.

AXIOM.Definition: A foundational declarative template expressing a truth-bearing logical or semantic state.
Runtime_Semantics: Loaded before all other template types
May appear alone or as the anchor for composite sentences
Constraints: Must bind to exactly one canonical primitive
Must not encode interpretation or intent

MODIFIER.Definition: A template that qualifies, constrains, or adjusts an AXIOM without standing independently.

CONTEXTUAL.Definition: A template that introduces scope, boundary, or situational context into a compiled sentence.
Runtime_Semantics: Applied after AXIOM and MODIFIER templates
May stack with other CONTEXTUAL templates
Constraints: Context only, no validation or negation

EXPLANATORY.Definition: A human-oriented explanatory template that does not participate in logical composition.
Constraints: Must not affect runtime decision logic

DISCOURSE.Definition: A multi-statement compositional template for discourse assembly.
Runtime_Semantics: May wrap or aggregate multiple statements
Constraints: Must not affect runtime decision logic

Invariants: Template types are closed and finite
Runtime sequencing is determined by Runtime_Priority
No template may declare an undefined Template_Type
Existing template types must not be redefined
